### Example

.large[
Suppose $X_1,...,X_n \overset{iid}{\sim} N(\mu, \sigma^2)$ with $\mu$ and $\sigma^2$ unknown. Let $\theta = (\mu, \sigma^2)$. 

.question[
Use the factorization theorem to find a sufficient statistic for $\theta$. (The dimension of the statistic will be greater than 1).
